Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Incilay
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome November 2011. I searched for a hotel that is fairly priced, centrally located to the activities we had planned for the 4 days we were in the city. I chose and made my reservation on line. When we got there, I was amazed! I had chosen not only a nice place to stay, but we were definitely centrally located. The tour bus stop is right across the hotel, but the hotel is not on a busy road, it is peaceful and quiet in the area. Lovely old buildings lined the road. The tour bus picked us up right in front of the hotel to take us to the Colosseum, and to the Vatican City tours. We walked or took bus rides to the close-by shopping centers. The street the hotel is on has many different open-air restaurants and cafes, and bistros to choose from. It is on the famous Via Veneto, where to film La Dolce Vita was filmed. The staff of the hotel was helpful. We requested a room on the ground floor, it was granted. The breakfast room is small, but cozy. Well stocked breakfast buffet. I would stay at this hotel next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome with Mother Mar 2012”
Reviews.Author: Jayne M
Reviews.Content: I really thought this hotel was great. Excellent location everything within walking distance. Clean,comfortable and with the friendliest staff I have had the pleasure to come across.They were all happy to help regardless of how busy they were or how daft the enquiry was. Good restaurants situated nearby. Nice breakfast. I would definitely go back. Like most european hotels there was no kettle in the room, so if you like a cup of tea when you get back in the evening..pack a travel kettle!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Rome sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Jacek J
Reviews.Content: Nice loceted hotel in Rome. Nice service. Breakfest not so good. Small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “ChrisandMandy just left after week stay - Excellent stay, friendly, extremely pleasant staff and excellent service - would use a”
Reviews.Author: Chrismitec
Reviews.Content: After staying here for a week, just after the snow hit Rome, we had a great week. Ideally placed for all venues, Spanish steps 10min, Trevi Fountain 15 min, Metro 5min. Hotel has very high standards, staff always helpful, breakfast very good, we are English! Double bedroom big enough, bed massive and shower always hot. Bedroom made up everyday with new towels and toiletries, free wifi access. Hotel in quiet location but centrally placed for easy access to Rome, not on busy road. Would like to thank all staff at the Hotel for great week.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: dkmerrifield
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our long weekend in Rome. It's on a quiet street, but within walking distance of lots of attractions. The free breakfast was good, and while there weren't tons of choices, we ate well. The room was simple, but very comfortable. Everything worked fine, and this hotel was very well-priced compared to others in the area. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean value”
Reviews.Author: martindhogan
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here- decent sized rooms, very clean, very comfy. Close to the Spanish Steps (very enjoyable 5 minute walk) Staff were great, helpful and very knowledgeable about the area- highly recommended and well worth the money. breakfasts were basic, but good, plenty of fruit and the coffee was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly staff, reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: fmrm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in great place, couple of minutes from Spanish stairs, villa Borghese, Hard Rock Cafe on Via Vittorio Veneto and many nice restaurants around the hotel. The staff was friendly, supportive and very informative. The room was nice and clean. The breakfast great. Next time we will definitely stay in this hotel. Don't take blue line bus for sightseeing, although the stop next to the hotel. They are usually late, just skip the bus stops and you will waste your time and money. There are red busses and many other sightseeing companies.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitali S
Reviews.Content: Ludovisi Palace wins hands down when it comes to Customer Service. We enjoyed our interactions with the hotel staff who were very warm and accommodating. The rooms may be small, but that is true of most European hotels so it was not a surprise. It was well appointed and clean. It was centrally located in a posh and safe neighborhood. An advantage for us was that it had very accessible parking close to the building. We walked everywhere - from the Spanish Steps to the Colosseum and Vatican City. There are also many restaurants close by. We got an especially good price on the room, so all was well!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: BayArea94116
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a few days during my honeymoon. When I was walked to the room, I could have sneezed across it. I asked the guy if there were bigger rooms (that did not face the street) and he said they were all the same size and there were no more "non smoking rooms". Thankfully, there was not too much street noise so it wasn't too bad. Considering we were just using the hotel as a "home base", given we were going to be touring the city most of our time, the quality of the accommodations wasn't a big deal in the end....just the price. The daily breakfast was nice. They have just about everything you could want. The main attraction to a stay here would be the location. Once we got oriented to the area, we walked everywhere. This was good because the cabs were few and far between around the hotel. The front desk staff was helpful, and their recommendations for places near by to eat were right on. If you don't mind the price for the location, and you aren't going to be in the room a lot, go for it. Otherwise I would look for more economical options. Oh yeah, unless you have a death wish, don't use their "private car service". We used them going to the airport and was never more scared during my 2 weeks in European traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: sorensenCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This was a sad experience. Be very specific when you book a room at this hotel - we found, that they put us ( Family of 3) up in a very small room and qouted incorrect prices for an eventual upgrade. It was definately NOT worth 4 stars - and the corresponding price - not even for Rome. Better value to be found in hotels like La Residenza nearby. Only comfort was that we found one staff in reception was very kind and helpful. I have travelled for leisure and business in Italy for more than 15 years - but this was sadly the wórst experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Muchka123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an eleven day bus excursion to Italy. We chose to start our trip with a pre-tour stay. Ludovisi Palace was great.Shopping was just a block away. I found it quiet in the evenings. I opened the windows and could see pedestrians walking arm and arm. We felt safe walking to the Spanish steps that evening . This is not an American hotel. Each room is different.. The rooms were on the on the smaller side. The bathrooms were modern and clean but small. Breakfast was buffet style. Other hotels in the area were plusher, with doormen in top hats...But this hotel was charming just the same. A great in-the middle of the action spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pjlandis
Reviews.Content: We used our priority points to book this hotel. After much searching using other reviews we decided on this hotel. Our room was very small but adequate. The breakfast was the best breakfast we had on our whole trip.The location turned out to be the best. We could pick up the hop on and off tour bus one block from our hotel which at the end of the day of walking is a welcome service and very reasonable in fact the best value for you money if you want to see a lot and learn alot about the city. The hotel staff was very accomodating with any questions or requests we had. You can walk to all of the main attractions from here and there are may good restaurants and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great american breakfast, and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AlisonDB_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nicely appointed and the staff is quite pleasant. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and about a 15-20 minute walk to Trevi Fountain. Along the way, you will pass so many charming outdoor cafes and gelato shops. The train station is also only about a 5 minute walk and is the perfect way to get to the Colisseum and the Vatican. This hotel is one of the few that offers an american breakfast with eggs and bacon. It's the perfect way to start your sight-seeing day!

Reviews.Title: “nice place, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: brandbridgeltd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ludovisi Palace is a good place to reach almost any part of Rome and its' proximity to the Spanish Steps is one of the highlights of staying at this fine hotel. The rooms are fine and rather on the small side. We had requested a room with a balcony and were given a nice little room on the top floor but the balcony had a brick facade so the only way you could look out was to climb on a chair. The room was very clean and the staff were all friendly and efficient. As do almost all hotels in Rome, a complimentary continental breakfast is served. The breakfast offerings were fair and served in two small rooms which are more like sitting parlors than a restaurant, so it was always cramped and crowded. All in all not a bad choice for a 3 star hotel in the heart of Rome so location is the key for selecting the Hotel Ludovisi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in a perfect location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Smileymiley27
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and we stayed in this wonderful hotel. Location was excellent and the hotel room was perfect and the airco was brilliant. Staff were so pleasant and they recommended a beautiful local restaurant for us to eat in, I recommend that you ask the hotel on where to eat. We got a taxi to the airport and the taxi driver was a gentleman. Overall 100% perfect

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: roseflan
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome in a group of 7, sharing 3 rooms. The room service was very good, hotel was very clean and all staff friendly. The concierge team were fantastic, very helpful with directions, advise on where to eat. They also arranged a beautiful birthday cake for one of our party. The barman Antonio was attentive to all guests, very friendly and funny!! There was a tour bus stop outside the hotel, a day ticket allowed you to hop on and off as many times as you liked, stopping just outside the hotel was very handy. I would certainly stay at the Ludovisi Palace Hotel again, particularly as I intend to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: obion
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perferct. Just a few metres from Via Veneto, Hard Rock cafe, and Piazza di Spagna. The staff at the reception were very helpfull and they even gave me a free wi fi Internet access for a total of 24hours. Breakfast was basic as well the TV channels on the room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jennymarino
Reviews.Content: just got back from a ten day trip in rome and positiano. was very surprised by the small rooms and "two double beds" (translation, two tiny twins), however, the location was great and the service was excellent....really excellent. front desk staff was above and beyond, always friendly, gracious, and very, very helpful. what lacked in room size was more than made up for with service and location. rooms clean, and no bathroom issues. we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DarceyLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a very good location, close to The Spanish Steps and Trevi Foutain - and not far from the Coloseum. Lots of restaurants nearby. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally helpful and the breakfasts were very good. Only crtisism was the fairly small rom and the shower that was a bit tempermental. However, for the price it was perfectly adequate and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ddolsons
Reviews.Content: We just stayed a week at Ludovisi Palace Hotel in Rome. The hotel has a great location just a few blocks from the Via Veneto. It's also close to Metro and bus lines and just a short walk to the Villa Borghese. The staff was outstanding, from the doorman to the front desk people! They assisted with scheduling day tours and transportation back to the airport. Our room was lovely with a flat-screen TV and CNN in English, a king-sized bed, and a great bathroom which had ample shelf space for toiletries, a clothesline over the tub, and a heated bathroom. The breakfast (included in the room price) was huge with scrambled eggs, bacon, cold meats and cheeses, fruit, cereals, yoghurt, and sweet rolls every morning. Juice and coffee were also included. Be sure to have earplugs as the hotel is on a somewhat noisy street, although this is typical for big cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jcloud44
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome with my wife and another couple. Our experience in Rome was fantastic due in part to the wonderful staff at the Ludovisi Palace. Maximo, Maria and Andrea were very helpful and courteous. They helped us plan excursions, dinners and just exploring the city in general. I would definitely recommend staying here. Located just off the main road Via Veneto, where all the high -end hotels are located. Convenient to the subway. Near the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “ideal in every way”
Reviews.Author: Ferrelled
Reviews.Content: Spanish Steps: Out the door, turn right; end of street, turn left; next right - Spanish Steps. Not only does that describe the ideal placement of the Ludovisi Palace but it sums up the convenience and location of the hotel. Breakfast was diverse and, even showing up in the last 30 minutes of the service time, the offerings were fully replenished. We were in Room 207 with two double beds and the best water pressure in the shower I've experienced in any hotel no matter the number of stars. The room was more than large enough for two people (or four - with ample closet and drawer space) and, though it faced a boring inner area, there was no street noise which could have been a factor given that Via Ludovisi is a street with a number of tour bus parking spots (though not in front of the hotel itself). As someone else has said, this is a neighbourhood filled with 4 and 5 star hotels yet is not a throughway. Nearly everything is an easy downhill walk from the hotel: Trevi, Coliseum/Forum. Leaving, of course, an uphill walk on the way home. And steps from Rome's version of Hyde Park/Central park. Recommended definitely. Though, surprisingly, very busy on the weekends and much less so on weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rickyroo81
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Rome and i can't honestly fault this charming hotel. Situated a short distance from the spanish steps this hotel is a great base to explore the wonderful city of Rome. The staff are always on hand and very friendly. We stocked up on the continental breakfasts before heading out as it can be very expensive in town. If your looking for a perfect citybreak be sure to checkin to the Ludovisi Palace, you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise value and location”
Reviews.Author: Philatraveler99
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the value and location of Ludovisi Palace Hotel. We chose it for the location, since it was near the Spanish Steps and the Metro, but we didn't realize how good a choice it was. Right around the corner are some very good restaurants, and there is a post office accross the street, as well as an ATM machine. Actually, it was a easy walk to Trevi fountain, and once you are there, you might as well walk to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona as well. For an after-dinner stroll, it is close the Villa Borghese. The value was the other surprise. We had a comfortable king size bed, and it was very quiet at night - even with the window open. Sure, it was not decorated like a 5-star hotel, but it was not shabby. Breakfast was very good and provided a good start for a day full of exploring. The staff was very helpful - even allowed us to use their office printer to print out our tickets that we booked online for the Vatican Museum. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for families and service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: Hockeyplayer773
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (including kids 7 and 9) stayed here after completing a cruise arriving at the Rome port which is about 45 minutes away. Our friends with 4 in their party too also stayed there. All aspects of the hotel are excellent including the family room (remembering that finding a hotel that accomodates 4 in a room is not easy in Europe) that had bath tub, shower, large bathroom, and individually controlled air conditioning. I started the reservation process about 6 months in advance, and always received prompt detailed replies to my queries. Our rate of Euros 199 per nite with breakfast was fair and well worth it. Being from Canada, I was surprised that the staff spoke English so fluently and it is hard to believe that it is not their first language. We had a quiet room that was clean, and great for our kids. What sets this hotel apart from many others is the service, and the knowledgeable and polite staff. Our transfer was properly arranged from the port to the hotel, and confirmed to us via email even when we were still cruising. Upon arrival (2 hours before check in), we were told that our room was not available (as the prior guest had not checked in) and that it would likely be ready within 45 minutes, and it was ready. In the interim, we were offered coffee and brochures to help plan our time in Roma. We asked many questions about sites, tours, restaurants which were answered with detail and insight. The manager, Andrea Contini, is the epitome of what hopes to expect from a 4 star hotel like this place. Other staff like Barbara followed the high standards set by Andrea, and would ensure that we did not go on wild goose chases for open restaurants and would call to make a reservation and ensure that our kids particular tastes would be met. A detailed map with highlighted directions would also be given as i am geographically challenged. The breakfast is fresh and has lots of items to choose from including various pastries, meats, scrambled eggs, bacon, meats, fruits, coffee, tea, and juices. I presume (rightly or wrongly) that Europe 4 star hotels are not the same as those in North America, but this hotel deserves its rating. Finally, our return transportation (8 people and luggage) on a Sunday on a day that is a holiday in Italy was again properly arranged ensuring that our whole trip ended positively. While there is much to do in Roma, staying at this property, in my view, will ensure that your bank is not broken, while enabling you to go to many of the sites (on your own if you wish) as it is centrally located within minutes of the Spanish Steps. Frankly, I would go back to Roma just to stay at this Hotel!! Trust me - I am also somewhat picky and would be the first one to try to deal with any disputes or problems that might arise, but alas, this hotel and its wonderful staff did not give rise to such things!!! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: ntm4
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel near the Spanish Steps. It was at least a 15 min walk...to get to the Spanish Steps. The rooms were clean, well appointed and nice. No complaints, just be aware that it is not centrally located. However,the metro is near the hotel and it is in a nice area. If this hotel is in your price range---book it!

Reviews.Title: “Scammers”
Reviews.Author: joecan29
Reviews.Content: The first day set the pace. We got there and had an argument with the taxi driver for charging us twice what we had agreed to pay befor entering the taxi. Tha hotel manager came out and did nothing to help us with the situation. When we were checking in we asked about the happy hour and appetizers the claim to have everyday on the travel sites. They stated that they do not know what we are talking about and nothing like that exists there. Big let down. This was in fact the one and only reason we chose this hotel. There are thousands of hotels to choose from and this is the ploy they use to get people in. I had expedia call them and the girl at the front desk from the hotel told the girl from expedia that they do still have that promotion and always have. A blatant LIE. This place is a scam and have nothing to to say about these shiesters, crooks, lies,, theives, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tvnewseditor
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Hotel Ludovisi Palace as part of a package with our airfare to Italy. I don't know exactly how much the rooms would have cost us independently, but it was a pretty good value, considering what we got. We took a train from Fiumcino Airport to Termini station and then took a taxi to the hotel. Total cost for the 2 of us including "baggage handling fees" (the random amount the taxi driver charges you for having suitcases) was appx $70. The good: The room was clean and although not huge, had plenty of space for 2 people. There was a small buffet breakfast every morning which never changed in the week we were there, but there was much more provided than at a standard american continental breakfast. The staff was incredibly nice and accommodating. When we arrived, the concierge immediately handed us a tour map and circled the closest destinations for us to begin sightseeing right away. In addition to the underground Metro, the bus service in Rome is really good and was extremely convenient to the hotel (and the red City Sightseeing Rome bus has a stop just 3 blocks from the hotel just outside the Villa Borghese!) The bad: the wireless was out for one of the nights of our stay. The WiFi is not installed, per se - you buy a wireless access card from the reception desk and that card is good on only 1 computer for 24 hours so if you travel with more than 1 laptop, you have to buy multiple cards. The hotel is on a hill which makes for quite an uphill walk home at the end of the day from most tourist sites (and the closest Metro station). My husband was dissatisfied with the lack of breakfast variety. There were too few covers on the bed for coverhogs like us, but the other sleeping problem was that there was construction in the restaurant on the ground floor of the building shared by our hotel and work started promptly at 8am each morning. Don't plan on sleeping in except on weekends. The TV had only a dozen or so channels, mostly in Italian. If you don't understand the language, your choices are a movie channel, Bloomberg, or CNN Int'l. Overall, this hotel was a fine choice for a weeklong stay in Rome. I would recommend it to friends and family. The location alone makes this hotel an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but overall worth it.”
Reviews.Author: travelsteve12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location with good staff and a great breakfast. The room is REALLY small, but overall the hotel is worth it. Especially if most of the day you will be sightseeing, the size of the room is a good trade off the location. 2 minute walk from the Spanish steps and other good things in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simple yet great place to stay and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: decktout
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many 5 star hotels during our travels over the years but when looking at Rome and trying to find one room for our family of 4 it was impossible without getting two rooms and spending more money than we wanted to. We chose to stay at the Ludovisi for 8 nights and while it was more basic than we were used to, it was perfect for our stay. The staff was fantastic, friendly and helpful. The daily breakfast included in the room price was ample and offered variety. I can not say enough about the location. We literally walked EVERYWHERE from our hotel. It was located in an upscale area with many restaurant choices in walking distance, steps away from Via Veneto and a nice walk to Piazza Barberini which had great gelato and restaurant options. After a long day of walking the city it was nice to be able to walk to a restaurant for dinner that was close by. Two king size beds in our quad room and a good size bathroom worked great for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with excellent location and informed staff”
Reviews.Author: MarchCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel in terrific location. The room was small but more than adequate, and the bathroom was terrific. A good warm breakfast and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star but Great location”
Reviews.Author: daff201
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night here in Sep 09. Brilliant location. Just round from Via Veneto. Lovely view from street but dont get stuck with back rooms. We were given 201 and it was dark and dingy looking on to shaft. The window didnt shut so we withough any hassle got moved to 502. Lovely views over Via Ludovisi. Room clean and fine. A bit shabby chique to be honest. Our door wouldnt open as you had to pull and then push it. We joked it was like Fawlty towers but the staff were really helpful and I wouldnt hesitate staying there again as long as it was on the street. Totally agree about comments about thin walls and the breakfast though

Reviews.Title: “definitely a very good surprise”
Reviews.Author: lorcar75
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review. I was there in september 08, spent a first night on my own for business (the hotel was very close to my conference center) and then my gfriend joined me. We had 3 lovely nights, as the hotel is very well located, the room and bathroom were much bigger than you can usually find nowadays, it was very clean and felt very cozy at the same time. The owner/manager with his family are very attentive and kind. Moreover, unlike many other people who convert their house in a hotel and suddenly become hotel manager, the guy had already many years of international experience in the hospitality sector. The "hotel" is a floor of an ancient building, so access with luggage is not that easy: door is tiny, there are steps, and the elevator is tiny and old. But i would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “a great location”
Reviews.Author: anglichanochka
Reviews.Content: Albeit thin walls and horrible breakfasts, the hotel is walkable distance to everywhere in Rome. The concierge was friendly and recomended lots of good places.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ascricca
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel in a great location, The staff is very helpful with anything. There are many hotels in this area to choose from ,all appear very similar is in appeal. Location is the key , many restaurants and bars to choose from, safe at all times of the day. Overall good spot!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay here because of over booking!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigpantsBristol
Reviews.Content: Having booked this weekend away back in January after extensive research on Trip Advisor we arrived on Friday evening 1st May to say that the hotel was fully booked and we were to be upgraded and moved to Hotel Dei Mellini which was quite some distance away from Ludovisi- anyway I was abit disappointed but Taxi fare was paid and off we went to Hotel Dei Mellini report to follow on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely quiet location”
Reviews.Author: galwaylass
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a weekend in Rome. Off the main streets so very quiet. rooms were clean and adequate. within a few minutes walking distance of Galeria Borghese, even if you have no interest in Art go there, its amazing. Also five minutes walk to spanish steps. If I was going to Rome again I would stay here again. Mind the restaurant /pub next door though, we went in for a drink on our way home and the bill was ridicilous

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cruisevacations
Reviews.Content: We arrived 2 days prior to Christmas, were greeted by a friendly desk clerk [wish I remembered her name], checked in at 10:00am, said we had a short visit and planned to 'hit the ground running.' The room was clean, comfortable, well appointed and spacious compared to other European hotels I've seen. Safe in room, ample storage, marble bathroom - clean. Wish the beds and pillows had been softer. When we came back down she had a map out, pen in hand, and started circling, directions, info and so much helpful advice to get us started to metro, Vatican, piazzas, etc. Other desk personned were equally helpful. Breakfast was fine - not exciting but a variety of cheeses, meats, runny eggs, soft boiled eggs, yogurt, cereals, breads/sweets, fruits, juices - enough choices for most tastes - and espresso/cappo made to order. Location was quiet. Price was inexpensive that week. We enjoyed the walk from the hotel to metro and piazzas. Had 7 - 9 euro taxi from Pantheon, Navona, etc. Would have enjoyed being closer to P. Navona or Pantheon area just for the nightlife. Would stay here again if price was reasonable - much less than quoted currently.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ludovisi”
Reviews.Author: leshin18
Reviews.Content: I started a month long vacation in Rome with my wife. This hotel was nice. The room and bathroom were clean but relatively small. The neighborhood was great and safe but be careful of the strong tourist element that exists on via venetto. Hotel Ludovisi's proximity to many landmarks is another plus. The staff was helpful and nice. Not the most bang for your buck, but thats what you get with an extremely weak U.S. dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel, godd price”
Reviews.Author: dome025
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for a business trip. Hall and common spacess very small and poor Room was too small with a nice decor; bathroom ok BIG PROBLEM: no mobile phone line!!!!! I had to go out in the street for making phone calls Breakfast service awful for a 4 star hotel. Room too small and bad food, ok for 2/3 stars hotel Anyway, payed 120 € and this price is good for a property located in that area (100 metres from via Veneto), but just for the location, not for for the service.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm and helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: Towlzy
Reviews.Content: We have relocated to Rome, and whilst awaiting our new home to be ready, we stayed at this hotel, my family consisted of my self, my wife and three children ranging from 7 - 14, the staff were great, the porter carried or 8 cases to the rooms, the room are not huge as is the room rate, and we stayed for 7 days, breakfast was tasty, and location brilliant, with everything in walking distance, the coloseum was 30 mins walk from the hotel. it was clean and tidy, excellent for a mini break or long term we have stayed at the hotel next door the Eden which was lovley with breakfast at 45 euros a head, and afternoon tea for 35 euros a head, and the Ludovisi would be my choice, a real family atmosphere. go for it ......

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff, and Location”
Reviews.Author: jagfan73
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ludovisi with a Globus tour group. We checked in a day early. The staff was extremely helpful in particular Alesandro. He gave directions to the subway station, and explained how to get around. It was lunch time and he recommended a great local restaurant. The next day it was raining and the staff suggested we got to the Capital museum which is near the Forum. After the museum it had stopped raining and just a short walk to the Forum and Colisseum. A subway station is just accross the street so an easy cheap trip back to the hotel. The room was small but very comforable. Clean bathroom and plenty of hot water. Breakfast was very good with a nice selection of meats, cheeses, sweets, eggs (Italians do not do eggs well, very runny scrambled eggs but that was the same at every hotel). Excellent location, only minutes from Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Villa Borghese, and the American Embassy. Subway station is very close. Everything is downhill though, Rome is very hilly, seven of them. Good reasonable restaurants around but stay away from the Via Venetto area, near the American Embassy as it is expensive. We enjoyed our time here and would definitely stay at the Ludovisi Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: t_win308
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trek through Rome and it was magnificent. We stayed at Hotel Ludovisi Palace and we were always treated well. The receptionists were great and gave us great advice on where to go. The porter took care of our bags. Always treated with a smile. Morning breakfast was good. Bacon, ham, cheese and eggs were the hot dishes. Variety of bread, pastries, fruits and cereals were the cold dishes. Got to choose from water, milk, oj, pineapple juice and grapefruit juice, as well as hot teas, coffees and hot chocolate. Just ask one of the waiters and they can fix you up cappuccino, espresso or hot chocolate. Location was good. We usually took the bus to most of the places we visited and there were stops just around the corner to take us to our desired destination. I recommend the BTI, 3 day pass for only 11 euros. It was a good buy. Also near the hotel is Villa Borghese, beautiful park, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately not stay there again - nor would I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: taekwondo1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small and the hotel is badly in need of refurbisment. There were cracks on the walls of our room...and the bathtub leaked from the bottom. The staff was friendly enough - but they did nothing to help us find another room in the hotel. In fact...we checked out early and went to another hotel. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a family”
Reviews.Author: italygirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ludovisi Palace in Rome for three days recently. I had a difficult time finding a hotel that could accomodate a family without booking two rooms, which would have been prohibitively expensive in a central area. The Ludovisi is within easy walking distance of Via Veneto, the Spanish Steps, Borghese Gardens, and Trevi Fountain; a bit more energy gets you to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. Rome is best experienced on foot so we wanted to be in a central, safe location. A bus stop across the street provides service to the Vatican City area. The hotel is nothing fancy, no grand lobby or restaurant, but it is located on a very nice, fairly quiet street - off the main road but just around the corner from Via Veneto. The room was clean and comfortable, not large by any means but not cramped either. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious for an Italian property and even had a bathtub, rather than just a stand up shower. Most importantly for us, the room had two double beds - a rarity in Italy - which allowed our family to stay together. The front desk staff was helpful if not overly friendly, which we found was typical throughout Italy. In general Italians are polite, but distant - they'll help if asked but don't go out of their way. Breakfast was decent if not anything special, though my kids were excited to see bacon and eggs in addition to the usual breads, cereals, fruit, juices and yogurt. A hotel room in Rome is just a place to sleep and shower, hopefully in safety and comfort, and the Ludovisi certainly fits the bill in that regard.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient Hotel, Good Value but Needs Renovating”
Reviews.Author: JRAR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ludovisi Palace Hotel from May 26 - May 31 and then again on June 4. The hotel is in a fantastic location; nearly all of the city's main points of interest are within walking distance, including the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, Campo di Fiori and Piazza Navonna (these last three are a bit of a farther walk, but when in Rome...). Also within walking distance is the Ancient Forum and Piazza Venezia. For those who aren't into walking, the bus and Metro stop is 5 minutes away. Another plus, the hotel is located on a quieter than average street in Rome, so you don't hear the constant traffic outside. Staff was helpful, but not overly friendly. Maria helped us with dinner reservations before our arrival, which was wonderful. Room was clean and comfortable, but not luxurious. Overall, in our opinion the hotel is in serious need of renovation, including new carpet, new light fixtures, paint/wallpaper, higher quality pillows and bedding, etc. The current decor is extremely dated. However, this would most surely raise their rates, which are quite reasonable when compared to other 4-star hotels on the same street. We will likely stay at another hotel in the future simply because we like a more luxurious atmosphere and are willing to pay extra for it. But, if you are looking for a clean hotel on a quiet street that is in a superb location at a good value, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Three days at the Ludovisi”
Reviews.Author: sixseven
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week tour of Italy. Our first three days/nights were at the Ludovisi Palace in Rome. Readers of this review must keep in mind that my wife and I were part of a large group and we do not ask a lot from hotels where we stay. That said I will say the Ludovisi is a pretty good hotel located in a good spot. Our room was comfortable but not fancy. Our bed was comfortable [important as we are both tall ]. Bathroom was comfortable but not fancy. Plenty of hot water and pressure for the shower. We easily walked to many sights in the area such as Trevi Fountain at night , Spanish Steps etc.. The area of the hotel seemed safe though we werent out in the wee hours of the night. I can't say anything about the public transportation because a large tour bus picked us up every day in front of the hotel. There are plenty of trattorias, bars, restaurants, and atm machines in the neighborhood. There is a bank directly across the street. A minor [just my opinion] disadvantage is some street noise if your room faces the street. Our room got a little stuffy during the day with the windows closed but cooled down at night with windows open[street noise]. We [my wife and I] would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hgry
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a long weekend at Ludovisi Palace. The hotel's location is perfect. Five minutes walk to Barbarini metro station. Walking distance 10 minutes from Spanish steps. A very upper class area. The hotel is clean but in need of a refurb, The rooms & bathrooms are a good size, the bedclothes and towels changed every day. The reception staff very helpful, especially Roberto. The self serve breakfast was good. Plenty of it, even hot bacon and egg, still plenty of it even when getting there at 10.15 in the morning. Plenty of bars and restaurants in this area. Dont bother with the Elephant Blanc next door to the hotel, the service and food are awful in fact worse than that, waiter couldnt care less and the food inedible, and it was the most expensive meal we had all weekend, Try the Tempio di Bacco, turn right at the Elephant Blanc, then next left and the Tempio di Bacco is there, a small restaurant with original artwork on the walls, Le Quattro Stagioni di Afro,. The waiting staff are very friendly and the food very good, an Italian chef. The Hotel Ludovisi is a perfect position for a long weekend and I would reccomend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “lovely ludovisi”
Reviews.Author: mrsdoyle_1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ludovisi palace for the weekend during the six nations rugby championship. It was a very clean well presented hotel. Breakfast was good, included eggs and bacon, which alot of european hotels don't. Room wasn't big, but as long as your bags are small, the room is comfortable in size. Staff were very helpful and encouraged the guests to give the itialian language a go. It was a three minute walk to Barbarini metro station. The hotel is placed in a good location however it is up hill from the metro station and the hotel itself (as many hotels in rome) has steps into the entrance. They do however have a chair lift for disabled guests. I really did enjoy my stay in this hotel and in rome in general. The hotel and rome itself felt very safe. I would definitely recommend ludovisi palace to friends. Great hotel, great location for spanish steps, trevi and resturants. I will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelCumbria
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just 10 minuite walk to spanish steps, and was very central, the hotel was great value for money the staff were very friendle and helpful. They even let us keep the room on after checkout and refreshed out towels free. Give this hotel a go strongly recommend this hotel for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dinos_a
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my wife and two children four five nights between Christmas and New Year. The family room was good sized, although not perfectly clean when we arrived. We arrived at 10.30 a.m. by an early morning flight from Athens, and fortunately the room was ready, so we wasted no time in sight seeing. The staff is quite friendly, especially at the reception, who were very helpful in providing information, booking restaurants etc. On our last day I became sick, and the staff were very attentive, and they actually provided me with a spare room to rest, as our flight was leaving at 9.00 p.m. and our room was already reserved. The spare room was though quite small, with no carpet and next to the reception, so if one stayed at this room for a couple of days, I am not sure if one could be happy… I would definitely stay again, but not in this spare room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: Richard_SW11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my wife and our two children. We had booked a quad room, but were given two adjacent doubles which was fine for us. The rooms are smart and the staff were very helpful, giving us good advice on local restaurants. The breakfast room is small and we were told it is possible to have room service breakfast at no extra charge. We did not have to wait for a table however. The location is excellent, within walking distance of the via Veneto and Spanish steps. I will stay here again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Tenerezza
Reviews.Content: I stood in Ludovisi 2 times - 1st in 2005 summer, 2nd in January 2006 and I like this place very much - rooms are small but pretty good. Hotel is situated near Via Vittorio Veneto (for russians - its like Tverskaya Street in Moscow))) and Villa Borgese - beautiful garden, not far from Piazza di Spagna & Via del Corso. I guess I can reccomend this hotel! I'm going to visit Roma in May 2007 and I'll stay at Ludovisi or Eden (le Meriden)- 2 steps from Ludovisi - just to try Meridien in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElvisinLA
Reviews.Content: Spent our first three nights in Italy here and really liked the place. Walking distance to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and a few Metro stops. Staff was friendly and pleasant, room and bed were good sized and comfortable. Very clean hotel and quiet. Daily breakfast was excellent! Plenty of wonderful restaurants around but I would definitely recommend the White Elephant Restaurant right at the corner of Ludovisi. Only minor issue was that it seems as though they turn the water off at night, or at least lower the pressure alot. I've been told this is common in Rome, but since I only stayed at this place I have nothing to compare it to. Overall, I'd easily recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurentine
Reviews.Content: Our advice is: bite the bullet and stay at one of the 5 star hotels that are within 5 mns of this place. Sure, via Ludovisi is a calm, charming location with direct access to Via Veneto and close to many points of interest, but this hotel just doesn't do it. We could hear the neighbours breathing in their room (no...they were just breathing normally) and there is literally no insulation whatsoever between bathrooms. That is, if you can get inside it. In 30 years travelling, I have never seen a bathroom this small - should be in the hall of fame of astute plumbers. Room OK-ish, breakfast room a small white marble affair featuring a disgruntled morning service guy and a poor choice of food. Would absolutely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days with my wife at Ludovisi and was my first time in Rome. It was a wonderful experience. I need to thank the Reception staff, they were very helpfull, especially Massimo one of the Receptionist. They helped me with restaurants, with tours, museums reservations and everything I asked. The hotel has a great location, just 5 minutes walking from the Spanish steps, 1 min from Via Veneto, Piazza Barberini, Borghese Gallery. The breakfast was really good. I will reccomend this hotel to everyone who wants to walk, without taking bus, taxi etc.. And hope to be back at Ludovisi

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ludovisi in September 2005 for two nights on honeymoon. I had spent hours going through lists of hotels and reviews on various websites and compiled a shortlist. We chose Hotel Ludovisi for the location and as it had better reviews than the Savoy. When we arrived, we discovered that our hotel was in the same street as the Savoy and looked very basic compared to the Savoy. The breakfast and room and general appearance of the hotel were basic. We chose to take a taxi from the airport to the hotel rather than spending hours getting lost on the Metro and it cost 35 euros. When checking out of the hotel we asked the guy behind reception to book a taxi for us. When the taxi arrived we asked how much and he said 'sixteen five'. Thinking this was cheap we were happy to accept. After a rollercoaster of a journey with the driver driving like a complete idiot and talking on his mobile phone we arrived at the airport and were charged 65 EUROS!!!! I am sure that the hotel guy must have had a cut of that. But after spending two days in a city where we were ripped off from start to finish, it was the final straw and we were just glad to fly home. Before we went to Rome, friends raved about the place, but we were very disappointed by the whole trip. This hotel is ideal for the location - close to the Trevi Fountain etc but I am sure that you could book better for the money - and if you do stay here - dont ask them to book you a taxi!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Much of a Palace”
Reviews.Author: SAS13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ludovisi for one night as an individual traveler (I arrived in Rome one night early) and three additional nights as part of a Globus Tour. The first hotel room I was given was full of cigarette smoke (the carpet reeked of smoke) and the view of the dirty, ugly courtyard was less than desirable. I called down to the front desk to see if the had any rooms that were non-smoking, and they said that they didn't, but would give me a room that the previous inhabitants hadn't smoked in. My 2nd hotel room had marble floors, because it was on the same floor as the lobby. This room was much better (nicer and cleaner smelling), but had the same view of the dirty courtyard--this one had steps and a door that opened onto the courtyard (see photos). Cigarettes and trash were everywhere. The hotel had made no attempt to clean up their part of the courtyard. The hotel staff was friendly to me on the first day, but turned very ugly when the rest of my tour group arrived. They were angry that one couple on my tour wanted the leak in their hotel room fixed (it was smelling of mold already), and that another couple was complaining that their hotel door didn't open properly. Another man couldn't use his safe deposit box, and gave up on the hotel staff and used a friend's box instead. The staff was complaining to me and in front of me, about these problems. They should have been embarrassed to have their rooms falling apart, but blamed their guests instead. They weren't happy to give people directions to nearby sites, and seemed to hate their jobs. We were a nice, happy tour group, and were treated as intruders. We weren't treated this way anyplace in Rome, except for at our hotel! Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small, but very good personal hotel. Lovely room and bathroom newly decorated. Service very good. My wife's birthday whilst we were there and they gave her a bottle of wine. Central to all the tourist attractions. Easy to get a taxi, bus and train anywhere. Breakfast in small restaurant, but ample to eat. Staff helpful and pleasant at all times Recommend hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Watch how you are charged”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay here, until the last hour. I got my room when I arrived from my international flight in the late morning, the room was fine, breakfast was pretty good. Location is quiet and reasonably convenient to the Via Veneto and metro. Even the phone charges were reasonable. I was quite upset, however, when the hotel insisted on converting my bill (which was in Euros) to dollars, at an unfavorable exchange rate. The clerk told me he was helpless to override their machine. Though I insisted on (and got) a manual charge slip, and refused to sign the automated one (in dollars), they put the higher charge through. When I called the manager after I got home, he promised me a refund, but I never received one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Ludovisi!”
Reviews.Author: ashleybga
Reviews.Content: The Ludovisi Palace was a wonderful hotel in a wonderful location. You are literally a 10 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, Via del Corso. The evening staff was extremely helpful (shopping, restaurant & sightseeing recommendations); the daytime staff seemed a bit too busy to actually help with anything. The evening staff also made reservations for us at Villa Borghese as well as with an airport shuttle company. The room was clean and the bathroom very spacious. The breakfast was the best we had in the three weeks we traveled around Italy. Bacon and eggs were a nice addition to the usual bread and jam! The air conditioning was great! You could actually adjust both the temperature and the speed...definitely not what I've experienced in other European hotels. We got a spectacular deal (140 Euros) because we booked at the last minute...it was a steal! We will definitely return on our next visit to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The room was a little small but manageable. The hotels breakfast was good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be centrally located in Rome.
